div.head:
¶ By the King.
Royal blazon or coat of arms.
❧ A Proclamation concerning the wellmaking of Soape.
div.p: HIS MAIESTIE intending the aduancement of the natiue Commodities of this Realme, and the preuention of diuers deceipts, commonly vsed in the making of Soape, with forreigne and vnsweete Materials, and of the excessiue rates in the Sale of ill Soapes at the pleasure of the Soape-boylers, being no Body Politique, nor gouerned by any good Orders, and resoluing to make that Manufacture of Soape and Pot-ashes, a worke of His owne people, did by his Highnesse Letters Patents vnder the great Seale of England, bearing date at Westminster the twentieth day of Ianuary last past, incorporate diuers persons in the sayd Letters Patents mentioned, by the name of Gouernours, Assistants, and Fellowes of the Societie of Soapers, within the Citie of Westminster, in the County of Middlesex, and did thereby grant, that it might be lawfull to and for them and their Successours, to vse and exercise the Art and Mystery of Extracting, Boyling, Imbibing, Burning, and Melting Pott-Ashes, or Pitt-Ashes, and of Sode, Berillia, and Soape-Ashes, out of the Materials growing in his Maiesties owne Kingdomes, and of making all sorts of Soapes, both hard and soft, with the said Pot-Ashes, Sope-Ashes, Sode, and Berillia, and other Materials of this Kingdome, and selling the sayd Soapes and Ashes.

And for the auoiding of fraudes and deceipts in the vse and exercise of the aforesaid Arts and Mysteries, His Maiestie did thereby giue power to the sayd Gouernour, Assistants, and Fellowes of the sayd Society, to choose yeerely foure skilfull persons out of the said Society, by themselues, or their deputies, for whom they would answere, to ouersee all Workes Workemen, and others vsing the said Artes and Mysteries within this Realme of England, and Dominion of Wales, or of any the said Commodities to be imported from any forreigne parts into this Realme of England, or Dominion of Wales, and to search and trie by the best meanes they could, whether the Soape were sweet and well boyled, and whether
the foresaid things were rightly wrought, And the fraudes and deceits which they should finde, to cause to be amended, according to their discretions and the Lawes and Customes of this Kingdome of England, and strictly to inhibite on His Maiesties behalfe, all workemen in the Mysterie aforesaid whom his Maiestie likewise did by the same Letters Patents forbid that none of them should put to sale within this Realme, or the Dominion of Wales, any Soape or other the premises before the Ouerseers or their Deputies should haue ouerseene the same, and should haue marked it for good.

And that after such inhibition if any Sope should be put to sale and found defectiue, or deceitfull, to arrest the same, and in publike place (declaring such deceits, and defects, to all that would bee present) to destroy the same; To which foure men, or any two of them, or their Deputies, His Maiesty did giue power and authority to execute all and singular the premisses, and to punish the gainesayers, and rebellers, if any should bee found, as by the said Letters Patents (amongst other things) more at large appeareth.

And the Gouernour, Assistants, and Fellowes of the said Society, did by Indenture sealed with their Common Seale, made betweene His Maiestie of the one part, and them of the other part (amongst other things) couenant to erect, and maintaine, as many workes, and to prouide such Materials, as after the first yeere from the date of the said Letters Patents, they might make fiue thousand Tonne of good Soape, for his Maiesties vse, and a further proportion if neede should require, and that the Sope to bee by them made, should euery way bee as good as the Soape contained in one Firkin signed with the marke of the said Gouernour, Assistants, and Fellowes, whereof an Assay and tryall was made, which was deliuered into the hands of Francis Coningesby Esquire, to bee safely kept vntill an other Firkinne of Soape for an Assay should bee there deliuered by the said Gouernour, Assistants, and Fellowes, and therewith to make triall of such Soape as should bee afterwards in like maner made, and that at the end of euery quarter of a yeere, or within one moneth after each quarter, they should deliuer one Firkin of Soape of like goodnesse, and that the Best sweet Soape should not bee sold ouer and aboue the rate of three pence the pound.

In which Indenture, His Maiesty did Couenant to cause a Proclamation to be set foorth for the further declaration of his intentions, aswell for the better maintenance and strengthening of diuers Licences, Liberties, Powers, Priuiledges, and Authorities granted vnto the said Societie, as for the prohibiting of the making and sale of vnsweet Sope, and of importing the same, and also that no Sope should bee put to sale before it were Assayed and tried by lawfull men to that purpose authorised and appointed by the said Letters Patents, and Indenture amongst diuers other things therein contained, more at large appeareth.

And for the better effecting thereof, His Maiestie did by His Letters Patents erect an Office for keeping of the Paternes, and making of the Assay of Soapes to bee made by the Gouernour, Assistants and Fellowes of the Society of Soapers of Westminster, and appointed the said Francis Coningesbie, to be the first Assay-Master, to make Assayes of the Soapes to be made by them for his Maiesties vse, and also to be an Assistant to the said Corporation, for the search of all Soapes to be made by others, when they should require him, for discouering of deceipts and frauds in the making thereof, if any should be: And that the said Francis Coningesbie should take Oath for the true execution of the said Office, before he should be admitted
to the execution of the said Office, as by the said Letters Patents more at large it doeth appeare.

His Maiestie therfore, to the end that all his louing Subiects may take notice of his Princely care herein, doeth straightly charge and command aswell the said Gouernour, Assistants and Fellowes of the said Societie, as all others that shall hereafter make any Soapes, that they vse no other Oyle in making of their Soapes, but Oliue Oyle, and Rape Oyle, as hath beene long sithence decreed by the Maior and Aldermen of London, that by that meanes the Soape may bee sweet, good, and seruiceable, according to the Paternes deliuered vp vnto the said Francis Coningesby, And also strictly inhibiteth, that no person or persons import, or cause to bee imported or brought into this Realme or Dominion of Wales, any vnsweet or vnseruiceable Soapes: And also that none presume to put to sale, or vent any Soapes, Pot-ashes, Soape-ashes, Berillia, or Sode, of what nature soeuer, before they shall bee assayed and tryed by the Searchers to be assigned and yeerely to bee chosen by the said Gouernour, Assistants, and Fellowes, and the Assay-Master for the time being, or some of them, and by them or him found to be good, vsefull and seruiceable, and so marked by them or their Deputies, with the marke appointed for that purpose, being the flowre di'luce, if any such Officers shall reside in the Townes, where such putting to Sale thereof shall bee and being required, will search and trie the same without Fee or Sallarie: Charging and commanding aswell the Gouernour, Assistants, and Fellowes of the said Societie, as all other Soape-makers, Soape-boylers, or sellers of Soape, Soape-Ashes, Pott-Ashes, Berillia, or Sode, aswell within places exempted, and in Franchises, as elsewhere, to permit and suffer the said foure persons, and the sayd Francis Coningesby, and his Deputie or Deputies, and all other Assay-Masters hereafter to be chosen to assay, trie, and marke all and euery their Soapes, Sope-Ashes, Pot-Ashes, Berillia, and Sode, either made within this Realme, or the Dominion of Wales, or imported into the same from any forreigne parts, without any manner of interruption, contradiction, or deniall, as they tender Our pleasure, and will auoyd the contrary at their vttermost perils.

Willing also and requiring all Maiors, Sheriffes, Bayliffes, Iustices of Peace, Constables, Headboroughs, and all other his Maiesties Officers and Ministers whatsoeuer, whom it shall concerne, that they and euery of them from time to time be ayding, helping, and assisting vnto the sayd foure persons, their Deputies, and the said Francis Coningesby, and his Deputies, and all other Assay-Masters, and their Deputies, which hereafter shall bee chosen into that place in the due execution of all and singular the premisses, as they will answere the contrary at their perils.
